article:
A 'macrocell' is a cell in a mobile phone network that provides radio coverage
served by a high power cellular base station (tower). Generally, macrocells
provide coverage larger than microcell. The antennae for macrocells are mounted
on ground-based masts, rooftops and other existing structures, at a height that
provides a clear view over the surrounding buildings and terrain. Macrocell base
stations have power outputs of typically tens of watts.
[http://stakeholders.ofcom.org.uk/sitefinder/glossary/jargon/ Mobile
Phones: Jargon Explained ]
